questions.question_text:
Cloud Kicks has been tracking how many participants wear the company's shoes in each marathon. The administrator creates two custom objects: Races and Runners. There is a master-detail relationship between them as well as a Roll-up Summary field on the Races object to show the count of runners in each race. Requirements have changed, and the administrator wants to delete the Master-detail Relationship field without deleting the Runners records.

What action should an administrator take before the Relationship field can be deleted?

choices.A: Delete the Roll-up Summary field on the parent.
choices.D: Change the field type to a Lookup Relationship.
choices.B: Uncheck 'Delete this record also' to turn off cascading deletes.
choices.C: Select the 'Allow Reparenting' checkbox on the Master-detail field.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
This says it's A...
https://developer.salesforce.com/forums/?id=906F0000000ArJcIAK

questions.question_text:
Cloud Kicks (CK) has an email parsing tool. CK wants to ensure that when certain fields are updated, the Case Owner is notified by email.

What should the administrator use to email the Case Owner?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Additionally to the below, an email alert in a flow needs to be in an After Save flow.

C
The administrator should use the After Save Flow to email the Case Owner. The After Save Flow is triggered when a record is created or updated and allows for additional actions to be taken after the record is saved. In this case, the flow can be configured to check for updates to the specified fields and then send an email notification to the Case Owner.

Email-to-Case is used to automatically create Cases from emails and would not be relevant to this scenario. Before Save and After Save Flows are used to automate processes and logic before or after a record is saved. Outbound Messages are used to send notifications to external systems when a record is created or updated.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct, as you're essentially deleting a record. Same applies to Leads.

questions.question_text:
A user is getting an error when attempting to merge two accounts. The administrator checks the profile to see the user has Read/Write permission on Accounts and is the owner of both records.

What is preventing the user from completing the merge?

choices.A: The Account matching rules are not set.
choices.C: The Delete permission is missing on the user for Accounts.
choices.B: Only administrators have permission to merge records.
choices.D: The user is assigned to the wrong territory.

discussion.content:
C
The "System" debug log category captures information about the system processes, such as Apex code execution, database operations, platform events, and email delivery. When troubleshooting an issue with a flow, enabling the System log category can be helpful as it provides detailed information about the underlying processes that the flow is interacting with. For example, the System log can provide information about any Apex code that is executed during the flow, any database operations (such as record updates or queries) that are performed, and any platform events that are triggered. By reviewing the debug log, an administrator or developer can identify any errors or issues that may be preventing the flow from functioning correctly and make the necessary adjustments to resolve the problem.

questions.question_text:
The administrator at Cloud Kicks is troubleshooting an issue one user is having with a flow. They have decided to add a debug log to that user.

What debug log category should be used?

choices.D: Fix the ProcessBuilder in a sandbox and migrate the change to production.
choices.A: Have the users refresh the Account page so they get the current Process Builder.
choices.E: Review the Error Email for the Process Builder and rectify the issues.
choices.B: Deactivate the Process Builder in production.
choices.C: Manually make the updates to the Account as the logged-in user.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CDE
C → E → D

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.process_troubleshoot_runtime.htm&type=5

Selected Answer: BDE
A. Have the users refresh the Account page...: This is a temporary workaround and does not address the root cause of the problem.
C. Manually make the updates to the Account as the logged-in user: This is not a scalable solution and only addresses the symptoms, not the cause of the errors.

The three things the administrator should do to resolve this issue are:

A. Have the users refresh the Account page so they get the current Process Builder.

This ensures that the users are working with the latest version of the Process Builder.
D. Fix the ProcessBuilder in a sandbox and migrate the change to production.

This allows the administrator to test and fix the Process Builder in a non-production environment before deploying it to production.
E. Review the Error Email for the Process Builder and rectify the issues.

The Error Email provides detailed information about the errors that are occurring in the Process Builder, and the administrator can use this information to identify and fix the issues.

questions.question_text:
Cloud Kicks has just released a new Process Builder on the Account in production. The end users keep getting error messages that prevent them from completing their updates to the Account.

Which three things should the administrator do to resolve this issue? (Choose three.)
